parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> 1.32

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.64

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns selection damage. Same as [[getHitPointDamage]], only the argument is selection part instead of hit point.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Some part names are in Czech; see [[Translations|translation table]].</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicle [[getHit]] selection

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle : [[Object]] - vehicle to be queried

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> selection: [[String]] - selection part name

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] (prior to Arma 3 v1.93.145625, [[Nothing]] was return when invalid ''selection'' was given)

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[getHit]] "head";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_car [[getHit]] "motor";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setHit]], [[getHitPointDamage]], [[setHitPointDamage]], [[setDamage]], [[damage]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]</root>
